sage.scene

Class RotationController

  • java.lang.Object
    • sage.scene.Controller
      • sage.scene.RotationController

  • public class RotationController
extends Controller
    RotationController is a Controller that applies a continuous (wrapping) rotation to each SceneNode it controls. Each RotationController contains an attribute rotation rate, the number of degrees of rotation per second to be applied. The default rotation rate is 1 (degree/second); the default rotation axis is [1 1 1]. Both of these can be changed using the appropriate accessors. The rotation is applied to each SceneNode each time update(double) is invoked, where the value of the update(double) parameter gives the number of milliseconds which have elapsed.
    Author:
    John Clevenger

      • Fields inherited from class sage.scene.Controller

        controlledNodes, CONTROLLER_REPEAT_TYPE_CLAMPED, CONTROLLER_REPEAT_TYPE_CYCLIC, CONTROLLER_REPEAT_TYPE_WRAP

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      RotationController()
      Constructs a RotationController with a default rotation rate of 1 and a default rotation axis of [1,1,1].
      RotationController(double rate)
      Constructs a RotationController with the specified rotation rate and a rotation axis as defined by the no-argument constructor.
      RotationController(double rate, graphicslib3D.Vector3D axis)
      Constructs a RotationController with the specified rotation rate and rotation axis.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      graphicslib3D.Vector3D getRotationAxis()
      Returns a new Vector3D giving the current rotation axis for this controller.
      double getRotationRate()
      Returns the current rotation rate for this RotationController.
      void setRotationAxis(graphicslib3D.Vector3D axis)
      Sets the rotation axis for this controller to match the axis specified.
      void setRotationRate(double rate)
      Sets the rotation rate for this RotationController.
      void update(double mSec)
      update() applies this RotationController's current rotation to each SceneNode to which it is attached, by concatenating onto the local transform of each SceneNode an additional rotation transformation as specified by this RotationController's rotation rate and rotation axis.

      • setRotationRate

      • getRotationRate

        Returns the current rotation rate for this RotationController.

      • setRotationAxis

        public void setRotationAxis(graphicslib3D.Vector3D axis)
        Sets the rotation axis for this controller to match the axis specified. The specified axis is cloned internally; subsequent changes to the Vector3D defined by the input parameter will not affect the controller.
        Parameters:
        axis - - the rotation axis for this controller

      • getRotationAxis

        public graphicslib3D.Vector3D getRotationAxis()
        Returns a new Vector3D giving the current rotation axis for this controller.
        Returns:
        A clone of the Vector3D giving the current rotation axis for this controller

      • update

        public void update(double mSec)
        update() applies this RotationController's current rotation to each SceneNode to which it is attached, by concatenating onto the local transform of each SceneNode an additional rotation transformation as specified by this RotationController's rotation rate and rotation axis. update() applies the RotationController's degrees-per-second rotation rate assuming that the mSec parameter specifies the number of milliseconds which have elapsed.
        Specified by:
        update in class Controller
        Parameters:
        mSec - - the number of milliseconds which have elapsed since the last time this controller's rotation was applied
